title: A merciful God would never allow children to die of Cancer

author: Important_Issue5522
text:
(All mistakes are from myself, all truth and good is from God)

In the name of Allah, the most merciful, the especially merciful

When we bring up the problem of evil, we should really question ourselves.

Are we witnessing suffering and honestly confused about where the greater good to it all is?

or are we rebelling against God and just using the suffering of children as ammo?

and lastly, what are we ourselves, who God gave limbs and intellect to act, doing about the suffering in the world?

Perhaps he created those suffering kids and then created you so your heart can be softened at their condition and so you can visit them and show them mercy and mercy is experienced directly through YOU.

Qur'an 21:23 - "He is not questioned about what He does, but they will be questioned."

author: Mkwdr
text: He tortured kids to soften our hearts (the condition of which he is also responsible for) , seriously? I dont suggest try that argument in a court. Also difficult to rebel against something that you don't believe in.

author: Important_Issue5522
text: If you're exhausting any energy in dismantling the concept of God, that's rebelling against the concept

author: Mkwdr
text: Nothing in my comment either dismantles the concept of god nor rebels in any way and neither of those two things is relevant to *whether torturing kids is an acceptable way of softening hearts*. You really do avoid any actual addressing of the specific point by attempting to shut down any questioning or  discussion don’t you.

author: Important_Issue5522
text:
>He tortured kids to soften our hearts (the condition of which he is also responsible for) , seriously? I dont suggest try that argument in a court.

We're not talking about human courts, we're talking about divine decree. No puny human being is taking God into a court and prosecuting him for giving kids cancer and winning. God owns and knows everything and He can do with His creation what He wills. How can a human seriously claim God did an injustice to some kids who, in the islamic paradigm, would be too busy enjoying paradise completely forgetful of their life with cancer.

and yes, seeing the condition of those less fortunate, whatever that condition may be, is designed to soften your heart and remind you to be grateful for what you have, especially health and to prevent you from being jealous of those with more.
